medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hypothyroidism was diagnosed at neonatal screening. Serum TSH was elevated at birth (TSH 144 /H9262U/ml) and confirmed 5 days after birth (TSH 179 /H9262U/ml). L-thyroxine treatment was initiated shortly after diagnosis. Currently, at 10 years old, she is being treated with L-thyroxine 87.5 /H9262g daily and has developed normally. Her thyroid function tests have remained normal throughout follow-up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Heterozygous mutations in NKX2.5 gene (S265R) and PAX8 promoter region were identified; no significant thyroid tissue was suggested by low thyroglobulin levels.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents and a brother are phenotypically normal and euthyroid despite carrying the identified mutations.
